data.enText: to mix two or more substances together

data.chText: 把面粉和牛奶调成均匀的面糊。
data.enText: Blend the flour with the milk to make a smooth paste.

data.chText: 把鸡蛋、糖和面粉掺到一起。
data.enText: Blend together the eggs, sugar and flour.
to form a mixture with sth
Oil does not blend with water.
Oil and water do not blend.
to combine with sth in an attractive or effective way; to combine sth in this way
The old and new buildings blend together perfectly.

data.chText: 他们的音乐融合了传统和现代风格。
data.enText: Their music blends traditional and modern styles.
to produce sth by mixing different types together

data.chText: 调配的威士忌；混合茶叶
data.enText: blended whisky/tea
blend/fade into the woodwork

data.chText: 默默无闻；销声匿迹；蛰伏
data.enText: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide
blend in (with sth/sb)
if sth blends in , it is similar to its surroundings or matches its surroundings

data.chText: 挑选和装饰格调一致的窗帘。
data.enText: Choose curtains that blend in with your decor.

data.chText: 窃贼很快混入人群逃跑了。
data.enText: The thieves soon blended in with the crowd and got away.
blend sth↔in
to add another substance and mix it in with the others

data.chText: 把黄油和糖打好，然后调入鸡蛋。
data.enText: Beat the butter and sugar; then blend in the egg.
blend into sth
to look so similar to the background that it is difficult for you to see it separately
He blended into the crowd.

data.chText: （不同类型东西的）混合品，混合物
data.enText: a mixture of different types of the same thing
a blend of tea
a pleasant or useful combination of different things
a blend of youth and experience

data.chText: 以上各词均指物质、品质、想法或情感的混合、掺合、融合。
data.enText: These words all refer to substances, qualities, ideas or feelings combining or being combined.
mix

data.chText: 指（使）两种或以上物质、品质、想法或情感等混合、掺合、融合：
data.enText: to combine two or more substances, qualities, ideas or feelings, usually in a way that means they cannot easily be separated; to be combined in this way

data.chText: 把所有的配料放在碗里，搅和一下。
data.enText: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
Oil and water do not mix.
stir

data.chText: 指搅动、搅和、搅拌（液体或物质）：
data.enText: to move a liquid or substance around, using a spoon or sth similar, in order to mix it thoroughly
She stirred her tea.
mingle
to combine or be combined

data.chText: * mingle可用以指声音、颜色、情感、想法、品质或物质等交织在一起，用于书面英语表示对某一场景或事件的感受或经历：
data.enText: Mingle can be used to talk about sounds, colours, feelings, ideas, qualities or substances. It is used in written English to talk about how a scene or event appears to sb or how they experience it.

data.chText: 笑声和歌声交织在夜空中。
data.enText: The sounds of laughter and singing mingled in the evening air.
He felt a kind of happiness mingled with regret.
blend

data.chText: 指（使）两种或以上物质或味道混合、掺合：
data.enText: to mix two or more substances or flavours together; to be mixed together

data.chText: 把面粉和牛奶调成均匀的面糊。
data.enText: Blend the flour with the milk to make a smooth paste.

data.chText: 烹饪时用blend表示把各种材料完全掺和到一起，用mix只表示将这些东西混合在一起。mix可指将食物、物质混合在一起，也可指颜色、情感、品质融合在一起。在这一含义中，blend主要用于烹饪语境。blend亦可用以表示艺术、音乐、时尚等融合和协调。
data.enText: If you blend things when you are cooking you usually combine them more completely than if you just mix them. Mix can be used to talk about colours, feelings or qualities as well as food and substances. In this meaning blend is mostly used in the context of cooking. It is also used to talk about art, music, fashion, etc. with the meaning of ‘combine in an attractive way’.
mix or blend?
to mix/mingle/blend (sth) with sth
to mix/stir/mingle/blend sth into sth
to mix/stir/mingle/blend sth together
to mix/stir/blend sth thoroughly/well/gently
to mix/stir/blend ingredients
to mix/mingle/blend flavours
to mix/blend colours
mixed/mingled feelings

ex.chText: 悦耳的音乐声和人群的嘈杂声混合在一起。
ex.enText: The pleasant music mingled with noises from the crowd.

ex.chText: 加入草莓，把各种味道混合起来。
ex.enText: Add the strawberry and allow the flavours to mingle.

ex.chText: 她感觉希望和恐惧交织在一起。
ex.enText: She felt hope mingled with fear.

synonyms.bx: 多指无形的东西，如情感、声音、味道等，混合在一起。

ex.chText: 把盐、面粉和肉馅和在一起。
ex.enText: Blend the salt, flour and minced meat.

ex.chText: 先不要加醋，让各种味道调和起来。
ex.enText: Leave the vinegar to allow the flavours to blend with each other.

ex.chText: 他们的音乐把爵士乐和流行音乐融合在一起。
ex.enText: Their music blends jazz and pop.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）柔软或液态的物质，如水、面粉等，调和在一起，或让不同的事物融合起来，使相映成趣或相得益彰。

ex.chText: 你最好把所有的材料放在大碗里拌匀。
ex.enText: You'd better combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.

ex.chText: 水分子是由两个氢原子和一个氧原子构成的。
ex.enText: A molecule of water is formed by combining two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen.

ex.chText: 他只有9岁，却知道氢与氧化合成水。
ex.enText: He is only 9 years old, but he knows that hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）不同的物质混合在一起形成一种新的物质。

ex.chText: 第一步是把粉末和温水搅拌在一起。
ex.enText: The first step is to mix the powder with warm water.

ex.chText: 水和油不相融是常识。
ex.enText: It is common sense that water and oil don't mix.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）多种物质混合成一种物质，且不容易再被分开。

ex.chText: 形形色色的人们生活在这座城市里。
ex.enText: A mixture of different people live in this city.

ex.chText: 把香肠、煎蛋和黄瓜混在一起放在面包里。
ex.enText: Fill the bread with a mixture of sausages, fried eggs and cucumbers.

ex.chText: 空气是气体的混合物，不是化合物。
ex.enText: Air is a mixture, not a compound of gases.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，多指不同的东西、情感、材料或不同类型的人的混合；化学术语指未经化学反应形成的混合物。

ex.chText: 汞合金补牙填充料
ex.enText: an amalgam filling

ex.chText: 读者可以在她的作品中看到这两种思想的结合。
ex.enText: Readers can see the amalgam of these two sets of ideas in her work.

synonyms.bx: 指不同事物的混合，通常用单数；作行业术语时尤指牙医用来补牙的汞合金。

ex.chText: 混合茶叶/烟草
ex.enText: a blend of tea/tobacco

ex.chText: 各种建筑风格的完美结合
ex.enText: a harmonious blend of architectural styles

synonyms.bx: 指由性质相同、类别不同的事物构成的混合品，如茶、威士忌等，或风格、特性等的融合。

ex.chText: 多种因素的综合作用可能导致了汽车销量的下降。
ex.enText: A combination of factors may be responsible for the decrease in car sales.

ex.chText: 哪些音在英语中是不能组合的？
ex.enText: What combinations of sounds are not possible in English?

synonyms.bx: 指共同存在、被共同使用或放在一起的不同事物的混合体。

ex.chText: 这份报告是不同来源的信息的综合。
ex.enText: The report is a composite of information from various sources.

ex.chText: 这个男孩的性格综合了他父母的个性。
ex.enText: The boy's character was a composite of his parents.

synonyms.bx: 指由不同成分或材料组成的混合物。

ex.chText: 人造有机化合物有什么用途？
ex.enText: What are man-made organic compounds used for?

ex.chText: 氧化铁是铁和氧的化合物。
ex.enText: Iron oxide is a compound of iron and oxygen.

ex.chText: 人们普遍认为教书是几种不同技能的混合。
ex.enText: It is widely accepted that teaching is a compound of several different skills.

synonyms.bx: 化学术语，指含有两种或更多的不同元素的化合物；也指由不同部分、物质、特性等组成的混合体。

data.enText: blend/fade into the woodwork

data.chText: 默默无闻；销声匿迹；蛰伏
data.enText: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide
blend in (with sth/sb)
if sth blends in , it is similar to its surroundings or matches its surroundings

data.chText: 挑选和装饰格调一致的窗帘。
data.enText: Choose curtains that blend in with your decor.

data.chText: 窃贼很快混入人群逃跑了。
data.enText: The thieves soon blended in with the crowd and got away.
blend sth↔in
to add another substance and mix it in with the others

data.chText: 把黄油和糖打好，然后调入鸡蛋。
data.enText: Beat the butter and sugar; then blend in the egg.
blend into sth
to look so similar to the background that it is difficult for you to see it separately
He blended into the crowd.

trans: 融入；与…融为一体；与…协调
与…打成一片；成为…的一员；融入

tr: the act of blending components together thoroughly
a new word formed by joining two others and combining their meanings
example: `motel' is a portmanteau word made by combining `motor' and `hotel'
blend the nuts and raisins together
he blends in with the crowd
This flavor will blend with those in your dish
This sofa won't go with the chairs

value.def: If you blend substances together or if they blend, you mix them together so that they become one substance.

example.ex: Blend  the butter with the sugar and beat until light and creamy...
example.tran: 把糖掺入黄油然后搅拌至滑软细腻。

example.ex: Blend the ingredients until you have a smooth cream...
example.tran: 将各种配料调和均匀做成乳脂。

example.ex: Put the soap and water in a pan and leave to stand until they have blended...
example.tran: 将肥皂和水放入平底锅中不动，然后让它们溶成一体。
大多数的威士忌都是调和而成的。

value.def: A blend of things is a mixture or combination of them that is useful or pleasant.

example.ex: The public areas offer a subtle blend of traditional charm with modern amenities.
example.tran: 这些公共场所将传统魅力和现代设施巧妙地融合在了一起。

example.ex: ...a blend of wine and sparkling water...
He makes up his own blends of flour.

value.tran: （有用或令人愉快的事物的）融合，混合，组合

value.def: When colours, sounds, or styles blend, they come together or are combined in a pleasing way.

example.ex: You could paint the walls and ceilings the same colour so they blend together.
example.tran: 你可以把墙和天花板粉刷成同一种颜色，这样看上去浑然一体。

example.ex: ...the picture, furniture and porcelain collections that blend so well with the house itself.
example.tran: 与房间本身非常搭调的图画、家具和瓷器收藏品

value.tran: （颜色、声音或风格）融合，交融，协调

value.def: If you blend ideas, policies, or styles, you use them together in order to achieve something.

example.ex: His 'cosmic vision' is to blend Christianity with 'the wisdom of all world religions'.
example.tran: 他的“远大设想”就是将基督教和“全世界所有宗教的智慧”融为一体。

example.ex: ...a band that blended jazz, folk and classical music.
example.tran: 将爵士乐、民乐以及古典乐糅合在一起的乐队

value.tran: 结合，融合，综合（想法、政策和风格）

trans: 融入；与…融为一体；与…协调；与…打成一片；成为…的一员
融入；与…融为一体；与…协调；与…打成一片；成为…的一员
高分子合金；共混聚合物；聚合物共混物；聚合物合金；高分子共混物
掺合比；调合比；掺混比；混合比；掺混比例
羊毛混纺；羊毛混纺标志；羊毛混纺标识
混合组成；掺和组分；共混料
